title: Thames & Kosmos Structural Engineering: Bridges & Skyscrapers | Science & Engineering Kit | Build 20 Models | Learn about Force, Load, Compression, Tension | Parents' Choice Gold Award Winner, Blue
descriptions:
Thames & Kosmos Structural Engineering: Bridges & Skyscrapers – Science & Engineering Kit

Build, test, and learn how the world’s tallest towers and strongest bridges stand up to the forces of nature. This intermediate-level kit lets aspiring engineers construct 20 working models while exploring core principles of mechanical physics and structural engineering.

Key features:
- Award-winning STEM kit: Parents’ Choice Gold Award Winner.
- 20 models to build: Bridges and skyscraper structures including truss, arch, cantilever, rope, and suspension bridges.
- 285 precision pieces: Columns, beams, trusses, plates, arches, shells, and catenary elements for realistic builds.
- Guided learning: 36-page illustrated experiment manual and assembly guide with step-by-step projects.
- Explore real-world forces: Investigate tension, compression, shear, and bending; understand loads, strength, stiffness, stability, and optimization for safety and cost.
- Hands-on experiments: A series of 20 model-building experiments that demonstrate how different designs manage forces and loads.
- Skill level: Intermediate—ideal for curious builders ready to go beyond basic kits.
- Color: Blue.

What kids learn:
- How columns, beams, trusses, and arches distribute loads in bridges and skyscrapers.
- The differences between tension and compression, and how shear and bending affect structures.
- Why design choices, materials, and geometry influence strength, stiffness, and stability.
- How engineers optimize structures for safety and cost in the real world.

What’s in the box:
- 285-piece construction set with specialized structural elements.
- 36-page illustrated experiment manual and assembly guide.

Perfect for:
- STEM learners ages 10+ seeking a deeper dive into engineering concepts.
- Classroom demonstrations and at-home engineering challenges.
- Budding architects and engineers who love to build, test, and iterate.

Build smarter, stronger structures—and discover the engineering that holds our world together.
